page.title: 09Upper Otter Valley:People 2
page.content: There are usually two or three generations on one farm.The old farmhouses are large enough to be converted into what is locally known as "parted houses",or the old outbuildings may be transformed into modern homes,or a new bungalow may be built alongside the main farm;so that the growing family group remains intact,with the grandparents handy to assist with the farm or domestic crises. The newcomers have been generally received in tolerant and kindly fashion,provided they are prepared to contribute to the life of the community.There is,however,occasional resentment if any attempt at "taking over"is suspected!
